OOC:
For whose the signal?

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <warrioraz=
ure@...> wrote:
>
> Jotunn was calm, but deep in his circuits, long calcula=
tions were
> being processed.
> 
> His office was dark, only the holo proje=
ctor giving off a blueish 
light.
> 
> He had cupped his chin in his hands =
and was thoughtful.
> 
> In front of him, the holo projector displayed a ta=
ble. It showed the
> number of minion attacks worlwide for the last megacli=
ck.
> 
> There was a drop in them.
> 
> Now was the time. And yet, what if =
he were wrong? He would not lose 
it
> all at the same time.
> 
> All he ha=
d to do was send one signal. One small signal.
> 
> One button.
> 
> Would =
he gamble everything? Would he risk it all?
> 
> His finger dropped a littl=
e hesitantly on the key. There was no
> turning back.
> 
> Iron Skulls worl=
dwide were sent a signal. It was a highly secret one
> on an undisclosed fr=
equency. They were required to open their comm
> channel to Ro66G.
> 
> Jot=
unn sighed in anticipation. He wondered if Megatron would have 
felt
> the =
way he did.
> 
> That was all the reflections he afforded. He waited for th=
e replies.
>
